author: Tim Bucks

text:
I have little doubt Trump did do all those things Cohen says. Does it matter? Not to me. Did it matter to the British that Elizabeth I was responsible for the beheading of Mary, Queen of Scots? Probably not. She defeated the Spanish Armada and that was more important to them. They did not want to be ruled by a Catholic appointed by Madrid. Can't really blame them. So Mary was forgotten and Elizabeth deified by the press of the day. 


As long as Trump doesn't cut off someone's head (or the equivalent), what he accomplishes for the country is far more important in my mind. If his motivation is to promote himself and go down in history as the greatest human who ever existed, what is that to me? Maybe he 'really' doesn't care about the country at all; maybe he just wants to make himself immortal. Whatever. If the country benefits, his motivation is irrelevant. At least to me.﻿

text:
Fun facts
Cholesterol itself isn't bad.
Cholesterol is necessary for hormone synthesis, cellular repair, and other crucial bodily processes. 
25% of cholesterol is dietary, our bodies create the remaining 75%.
When you eat less cholesterol, your body makes more cholesterol.
When you eat more cholesterol, your body makes less cholesterol.
You can have 1/5 the cholesterol levels of someone else while also being 5x more likely to have a heart attack.﻿

author: Maryland Bass Hunter

text:
​@CIA_Proxy For the record, Trump said "Russia, if you're listening, I hope you're able to find Hillary's 30,000 missing emails." It was A JOKE, and it was explicitly NOT a demand to hack anything. It was presumed that somebody could have accessed her emails already, and we learned in congressional filings just last year that, in fact, there's evidence to show a carbon copy of each one of her private server emails had been obtained by a foreign entity.

Donald Jr. met with a Russian lawyer who was a client of Fusion GPS, the same company hired to write the Trump Dossier. The Trump Tower meeting was a brilliant scheme by Glenn Simpson of Fusion GPS to give his Russian client what she wanted (the opportunity to speak to someone who had the ear of the potential next president) and give Hillary Clinton what she wanted: Evidence of Trump "colluding with the Russians." Unfortunately for Hillary Clinton and those protecting her, that meeting was largely unproductive, and the exchange of the alleged information would not have been a crime in the first place.

And lastly, "Russian owned WikiLeaks" is the most silly, uninformed, and ignorant point of your whole comment. Wikileaks is NOT Russian owned and Julian Assange has stated on numerous occasions that his source was not Russia. He DID seem to imply a certain deceased DNC staffer was his source in an interview on Dutch TV in 2016, however.﻿
